result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin Patrick McColly was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Design.Drugs(>50g), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(hm)4.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Pay all of following by the end of supervision.   Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  To be paid by the end of supervision.   All Court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
All applicable fees of supervision.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.  *5/23/2016 Honorable Timothy M. Witkowiak-Order signed.  Credit amended to 77 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
No alchol or drugs.
No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
Follow all rules of supervision. Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment.  Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation deaprtment.  Absolute/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; also advised that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt: Decision and Order DENYING Motion for Sentence Credit signed and filed.  Copies to the District Attorney's Office and defendant.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Timothy M. Witkowiak, Br. 22, for review.  mag
Defendant's pro se motion for sentence credit.
Letter to and from defendant.
Per Order signed on 5/23/2017:  "Ordered, JOC  amended to reflect 77 days of sentence credit".
Order GRANTING Sentence Credit signed and filed.  Copies to the District Attorney's Office and defendant.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Timothy M. Witkowiak, Br. 22, for review.  spc
Letter from defendant with revocation order and warrant in case 12CF003666.
Letter to defendant.
Defendant's pro se request for sentence credit.
Original Transcript (21 pages) commencing 12/02/2015 SENTENCING HEARING received and filed.

Defendant Kevin Patrick McColly in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Kevin Patrick McColly in custody.  Patricia Irene Daugherty for Laura Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  6.5 YEARS with 74 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program but IS eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program. 

 Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Memorandum- Court ordered sealed

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Letters in Support of the Defendant received and filed.

Defendant Kevin Patrick McColly in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Kevin Patrick McColly in custody.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to negotiations, the "second and subsequent offense" enhancer is dismissed.  As to the amended Count1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Bridget Joy Krause in court, defendant Kevin Patrick McColly not in court, in custody.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Plea hearing, however defense requests more time fpr community service.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kevin Patrick McColly in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Kevin Patrick McColly in custody.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Plea hearing, however parties requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kevin Patrick McColly in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea hearing, however parties requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Order to Produce for Plea Hearing on August 11, 2015 @ 1:30 pm received and filed

Attorney Bridget Joy Krause in court, defendant Kevin Patrick McColly not in court, in custody.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PROJECTED PLEA on 8/11/2015 at 1:30 pm.   Parties advised effective August 1, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22, Room 608 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Kevin Patrick McColly in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Kevin Patrick McColly in custody.  Chad Wozniak for Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kevin Patrick McColly in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Kevin Patrick McColly in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
